put something ↔ aside.translation[0].def: to try to stop thinking about a problem, argument, or disagreement, because you want to achieve something
You must put aside your pride and apologise to him.
to save money regularly, usually for a particular purpose
She put at least £30 a week aside for food.
to put down something you are reading or working with, in order to start doing something else
He glanced at the note, put it aside and went on with the meeting.
to keep a period of time free in order to be able to do something
If you’re planning a trip to the museum, be sure to put aside at least an hour and a half.
